main

Class RelCoordinates

  • java.lang.Object
    • main.RelCoordinates

  • public class RelCoordinates
extends java.lang.Object
    Name: Jaskaranbir Dhillon
    Date: Thursday, April 22, 2016
    Class Description:

    Used to calculation relative position of a point.
    Calculates the location with 224 pixel height has base.

    • Method Detail

      • getRelX

        public static float getRelX(int x)
        Gives the relative position of X-ordinate with that respective height.
        Parameters:
        x - The position of x-ordinate when height of window is 224.
        Returns:
        The position of relative x-ordinate at given height.

      • getRelY

        public static float getRelY(int y)
        Gives the relative position of Y-ordinate with that respective height.
        Parameters:
        y - The position of y-abscissa when height of window is 224.
        Returns:
        The position of relative y-abscissa at given height.

      • getRelCoords

        public static java.lang.String getRelCoords(int x,
                                            int y)
        Gives the relative position of coordinates with that respective height. Intended to be used in SVG Collision Data definition Strings.
        Parameters:
        x - The position of x-ordinate when height of window is 224.
        y - The position of y-abscissa when height of window is 224.
        Returns:
        The String format of relative coordinates separated by comma.

      • getRelCoords

        public static java.lang.String getRelCoords(int x,
                                            int y,
                                            int x1,
                                            int y1)
        Gives the relative position of coordinates with that respective height. Intended to be used in SVG Collision Data definition Strings.
        Almost same as getRelCoords method; except provides procedure for two points instead of one.
        Parameters:
        x - The position of first x-ordinate when height of window is 224.
        y - The position of first y-abscissa when height of window is 224.
        x1 - The position of second x-ordinate when height of window is 224.
        y1 - The position of second y-abscissa when height of window is 224.
        Returns:
        The String format of two relative coordinates each separated by comma.

      • getRelCoordsArr

        public static float[] getRelCoordsArr(int x,
                                      int y)
        Gives an array containing relative position of coordinates with that respective height. Intened to be used for generators in Main class.
        Parameters:
        x - The position of x-ordinate when height of window is 224.
        y - The position of y-abscissa when height of window is 224.
        Returns:
        Array containing relative coordinates at given height.
